about.title: About Koinvote
about.introBold: Koinvote is a forum for Bitcoin holders, where opinions carry real and transparent influence according to their holdings.
about.intro: Through Koinvote, Bitcoin will evolve from an asset into a right. We believe that as Bitcoin adoption grows, this power will make an unparalleled contribution to human peace.
about.feature2: the Bitcoin related to your message signing never leaves your own address
about.feature3: all replies and holding information are publicly verifiable
about.feature4: earn potential returns by participating in events
about.outro: Through these features, we will provide a secure and effective platform to discover and deliver opinions from Bitcoin holders.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.notice: You may use koinvote.com without submitting any personal information, for example by using Tor or anti-chain-analysis services. If you are concerned about your personal information being collected on this platform, it is your responsibility to take protective measures.
privacy.s1_1_text: Used to verify balances and determine voting weight.
privacy.s1_2_text: Used to verify actions and ensure authenticity.
privacy.s1_3_text: Publicly displayed on the platform as part of events, accessible to all users for review and audit.
privacy.s1_5_text: Such as IP addresses, report counts, and device usage data, used to prevent abuse and maintain security.
privacy.s2_1: To ensure transparency, all successfully submitted Bitcoin addresses, signatures, plaintexts, and reply content will be publicly disclosed for audit purposes.
privacy.s2_2: Replies may be invalidated or reduced to zero weight before the event deadline by submitting a new signature or transferring funds, but previously submitted signatures and records will not be deleted.
privacy.s2_3: Payout reports will disclose winning addresses, prize distribution amounts, and verification files for independent user validation.
privacy.s3_intro: The platform will not share users' non-public information with third parties, unless:
privacy.s3_1: You have given explicit prior consent;
privacy.s4_1: The platform does not and will never require access to your private keys.
privacy.s4_2: While reasonable security measures are implemented, absolute security of data transmission and storage cannot be guaranteed.
privacy.s5_1: This policy may be updated from time to time and will be announced on the website.
privacy.s5_2: Continued use of the platform constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.s1: By using koinvote.com, you agree to comply with the following terms. If you do not agree, please stop using this platform.
terms.s2: Koinvote is a Bitcoin-based forum where users can create events with prize pools and countdown timers. Users submit replies using Bitcoin addresses and verify them through digital signatures. After the event ends, rewards will be drawn and distributed based on Bitcoin balance snapshots, with a public payout report generated.
terms.s3: The Bitcoin you use must not originate from illegal sources, nor may it be involved in money laundering or other unlawful activities. When participating in replies, you must hold a Bitcoin address with a balance greater than zero.
terms.s4_1: When making a payment, you must ensure that the transaction to the platform’s receiving address generates a single, complete output. If the payment is split into multiple outputs within the same transaction, the system may treat it as abnormal and may trigger a refund.
terms.s4_2: To initiate an event, payment must be made to the platform’s designated receiving address, and the amount must exactly match the specified amount.
terms.s4_3: Underpayments: If the amount sent is below a platform-defined threshold, it will be treated as a donation. Otherwise, it will trigger a refund.
terms.s4_4: Overpayments: Any amount paid in excess of the specified amount will be handled separately. If the overpaid amount exceeds a platform-defined threshold, it will be refunded; otherwise, it will be treated as a donation.
terms.s4_5: Refunds are subject to deduction of on-chain transaction fees and refund processing fees.
terms.s5_1: Reward draws are conducted based on Bitcoin balance snapshots, with the snapshot block height defined as the first block generated after the event deadline.
terms.s5_2: The winning probability of each address is determined by its Bitcoin holdings at the time of the snapshot.
terms.s5_3: After deducting service fees and on-chain transaction fees, the remaining reward pool will be distributed proportionally to the winning addresses based on their holdings.
terms.s5_4: Each reward is drawn independently. The same address cannot win more than once within the same reward draw but may win multiple times across different prizes.
terms.s5_5: If the payout amount for a winning address is below the minimum payout threshold (Dust Rule), the reward will be redistributed.
terms.s6_1: You must ensure that the Bitcoin address you provide is accurate.
terms.s6_2: You agree not to use this platform for any illegal or disruptive activities, including but not limited to money laundering, fraud, abuse of reporting, or system attacks.
terms.s6_3: You must not distribute personal data, hate speech, or any other unlawful, inappropriate, or rights-infringing content through this platform.
terms.s7_1: Administrators reserve the right to hide or lock events and replies, and may initiate refunds when necessary.
terms.s7_2: The platform reserves the right to suspend services for maintenance or policy reasons.
terms.s8_1: The platform executes payouts automatically as designed and is not liable for any losses caused by blockchain delays, fee fluctuations, user input errors, or system hacking.
terms.s8_2: You use this platform at your own risk.

charges.title: Charges and Refunds
charges.s1_1_text: A platform service fee of 2% will be deducted from each event reward pool.
charges.s1_2_text: All reward distribution and refund transactions are subject to Bitcoin network fees, based on the recommended fee rate at the time of processing.
charges.s1_3_text: The minimum reward amount is 0.0005 BTC. Payments below this amount will be treated as donations and will not be refunded.
charges.s1_4_text: 10,000 sats. If a winner’s reward is below this amount, it will not be distributed directly but added to the redistribution pool.
charges.s1_5_text: A refund processing fee applies to each refund, currently set at 0%.
charges.s2_1_text: If a payment transaction generates multiple outputs within the same transaction, it may be treated as abnormal and will NOT trigger a refund.
charges.s2_2_text: If the payment is above 0.0005 BTC but insufficient for the event requirement, the system will automatically refund.
charges.s2_3_text:
If the payment exceeds the required amount:
- Any excess below 0.0005 BTC will be treated as a sponsorship to the platform.
- Any excess of 0.0005 BTC or more will be refunded.
charges.s2_4_text:
All refunds will be subject to:
- Bitcoin network transaction fee
- Platform refund processing fee

If the refundable amount is insufficient to cover these costs, no refund will be issued.

rewardTerms.title: Terms of Reward Distribution
rewardTerms.intro: This document defines the rules and mechanisms of reward distribution, which are based on a weighted selection process using Bitcoin holdings.
rewardTerms.s1_1: The snapshot is taken at the first block generated after the event deadline, with 1 confirmation required.
rewardTerms.s1_2: Only confirmed UTXOs are counted; unconfirmed transactions are excluded.
rewardTerms.s2_1: The participating address must hold a non-zero balance, and the funds must not originate from illegal activities.
rewardTerms.s2_2: Eligibility is based on the latest valid signature of the address within the platform.
rewardTerms.s2_3: If a new signature is detected before the event deadline, the previous one automatically becomes invalid.
rewardTerms.s3_1: Random draws are conducted using holdings as weights.
rewardTerms.s3_2: Each reward pool is drawn independently.
rewardTerms.s3_3: The same address can win only once per reward pool, but may win again in different reward pools.
rewardTerms.s4_0: Before distribution, the total reward pool will have fees deducted from it:
rewardTerms.s4_3: The net distributable reward pool, after fees are deducted from the total, is allocated proportionally to winners based on their holdings.
rewardTerms.s5_2: If a winner’s reward is below this threshold, it is not distributed directly but enters the redistribution pool.
rewardTerms.s6_1: will be redistributed according to winners’ holdings.
rewardTerms.s6_2: If a remainder is generated during rounding, it will be assigned to the address with the largest holdings.
rewardTerms.s7_1: If the number of participants is fewer than the number of winners, all participants win.
rewardTerms.s7_2: If there are no replies, the remaining balance after transaction fees is refunded to the refund address.
rewardTerms.ex1_block:
Total reward: 1 BTC
Number of winners: 2
Participants and holdings:
A: 8 BTC, B: 1.5 BTC, C: 0.5 BTC
Selection process:
Round 1: A (80%), B (15%), C (5%) @ assume A wins
Round 2 (A removed): B (75%), C (25%) @ assume B wins
Reward distribution:
Net distributable reward = Total reward - Platform fee - Transaction fee
A receives: (8/9.5) — Net reward
B receives: (1.5/9.5) — Net reward
rewardTerms.ex2_block:
Total reward: 0.05 BTC = 5,000,000 sats
Platform fee (assume 2%): 100,000 sats
Transaction fee (assume): 12,000 sats
Minimum payout threshold (assume): 10,000 sats
Net distributable reward: 5,000,000 - 100,000 - 12,000 = 4,888,000 sats
Winners and holdings (assume):
A: 8 BTC; B: 1.5 BTC; C: 0.001 BTC

Steps:
1. Calculate provisional rewards (proportional to holdings, rounded down; remainder handled in Step 3)
A = 4,115,777 sats
B = 771,708 sats
C = 514 sats @ below the 10,000-sat threshold, treated as Dust
Total = 4,887,999 sats, remainder = 1 sat

2. Redistribute Dust 514 sats (proportional to holdings, rounded down; remainder handled in Step 3):
A receives 432 sats
B receives 81 sats
Remainder = 1 sat

3. Redistribute remainders:
1 sat from Dust + 1 sat from Step 1 @ total 2 sats
Assigned to the largest holder (A)

4. Final distribution:
A = 4,115,777 + 432 + 2 = 4,116,211 sats
B = 771,708 + 81 = 771,789 sats
C = 0 sats
